applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to the pension life cover scheme rules document for several reasons: 1) The regulation specifically pertains to loss adjustors and expert appraisers in the context of processing insurance claims, while this document is about pension scheme rules for death benefits. 2) The document outlines the rules and administration of a pension scheme, not claims processing procedures. 3) While the document does discuss death benefit claims, it does not mention or involve loss adjustors or expert appraisers in the claims process. Instead, it specifies that claims are handled directly between the trustee, the life office (AIB life), and the beneficiaries. 4) The document's claims process is governed by pension legislation (Pensions Act 1990) and tax law (TCA), not insurance claims regulations. The scheme is structured as a pension product rather than an insurance product, despite having a life cover component.
regulation_title: Engagement of loss adjustor or expert appraiser
regulation_text: 357. (1) Where an insurance undertaking engages the services of a loss adjustor or an expert appraiser, or both, for the purposes of assisting in the processing of a claimant's claim, it shall provide the claimant with the contact details of the person engaged. (2) When an insurance undertaking provides a claimant with contact details for the purposes of paragraph (1), the insurance undertaking shall, at the same time, notify the claimant on paper or on another durable medium that the person engaged acts in the inter est of the insurance undertaking and such notification shall include an explanation of the function of the person engaged.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
